... core)，用金属箔材、纸或玻璃纤维布等骨架材料和胶粘剂制成的蜂窝状材料。用于制造蜂窝夹层结构等。49、夹层结构(sandwich structure)，在两层面板材料之间一层芯材(如蜂窝芯、泡沫塑料、波纹板等)胶接而成的结构。50、胶接接头(joint)，用胶粘剂把两个相邻的被粘物胶接在一起的部位。.

phrase.cizu_name: the meat (或 filling) in the sandwich

jx.jx_en_mean: a person who is awkwardly caught between two opposing factions
jx.jx_cn_mean: 夹在对立的双方之间的人，处于左右为难境地的人

phrase.cizu_name: a sandwich (或 two sandwiches) short of a picnic

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: named after the 4th Earl of Sandwich (1718–92), an English nobleman said to have eaten food in this form so as not to leave the gaming table

entry.def: A sandwich usually consists of two slices of bread with a layer of food such as cheese or meat between them.
If you sandwich two things together with something else, you put that other thing between them. If you sandwich one thing between two other things, you put it between them.

example.ex: Sandwich the two halves of the sponge together with cream...
example.tran: 在两半儿海绵蛋糕中间夹入奶油。

example.ex: When you write, avoid sandwiching the bad news between an irrelevant, indirect, or overly cushioned beginning and end.
example.tran: 在写文章时，不要把坏消息夹在毫不相关、拐弯抹角或过度铺垫的开头和结尾中间。

means.word_mean: 1. two (or more) slices of bread with a filling between them
2. insert or squeeze tightly between two people or objects;

sentences.sentence: "She was sandwiched in her airplane seat between two fat men"

auth_sentence.content: What does anyone care about a year-old cheese sandwich?
auth_sentence.res_content: What does anyone care about a year-old cheese sandwich?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What does anyone care about a year-old cheese sandwich?

auth_sentence.content: Hulking and unrestrained, this sandwich is over-the-top delicious.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hulking and unrestrained, this sandwich is over-the-top delicious.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hulking and unrestrained, this sandwich is over-the-top delicious.

auth_sentence.content: Now spread the curd thickly to sandwich the sponges together.
auth_sentence.res_content: Now spread the curd thickly to sandwich the sponges together.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Now spread the curd thickly to sandwich the sponges together.

Sentence.sentence: I'm not sure what I'm in a mood for. Ice-cream or sandwiches?
He usually prefers ice-cream to sandwiches

sentences.en: To make a ham sandwich you put a slice of ham between two slices of bread.
sentences.cn: 把一片火腿夹在两片面包之间就做成了火腿三明治。

sentences.en: He was sandwiched between two very fat women on the bus.
sentences.cn: 在公共汽车上, 他被挤在两个胖女人中间。

jushi.english: People should not often eat sandwich made of chicken and fine flour.
jushi.chinese: 人们不应该经常食用精粉和鸡肉制的三明治。
这三明治一点味道也没有。

jushi.english: The sandwich ought to be good—I used the very best ingredients.
jushi.chinese: 三明治应该是好的——我用了最好的配料。
